subject: Soccer
World Cup (Soccer)
lead_paragraph: The United States will begin the final round of World Cup qualifying in the Concacaf region by hosting Mexico on Feb. 11. The draw was held Saturday morning in Johannesburg in conjunction with the draw for the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, which will be played in South Africa a year before it hosts the 2010 World Cup. The other teams in the group are Honduras, El Salvador, Costa Rica, and Trinidad and Tobago. The top three finishers will go to South Africa, and a fourth team will enter a playoff against the fifth-place finisher in South America for another berth.
